Use portable fans: Portable fans can help circulate air in the room, making it feel cooler or warmer, depending on the direction of the fan.
Use blankets and comforters: Blankets and comforters can be used to insulate the room, keeping it warmer during cold weather and cooler during hot weather.
Use reflective materials: Reflective materials, such as aluminum foil or mylar, can be used to reflect heat and keep the room cooler.
Use plants: Indoor plants can help regulate temperature by absorbing excess moisture and releasing oxygen.
Use a dehumidifier or humidifier: A dehumidifier can remove excess moisture from the air, while a humidifier can add moisture to the air, both of which can help regulate temperature.
